sub_title: Senior Policy Advisor, Staff Education and Research at HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
summary:
Specialties: 
•	Policy making and implementation
•	Change management
•	Project management
•	Management
•	Research and (higher) education
•	Higher education law and regulations
•	Internationalization (incl. IaH)
•	Gender and ethnicity
•	Coaching (writers, researchers, teachers)
•	American literature and culture
•	English language and writing

education.field_of_study: English, Math, History, Spanish, Biology, Chemistry, and Psychology.

company.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: Policy advisor in the area of educational law and regulations, as well as policy related to the existing Boards of Examiners.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor, Staff Education and Research

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: Chair of the new Certification Board of HU's Teacher Training Center (Teaching & Learning Center, formerly Expertisecentrum docent HBO) at the Faculty of Education.
profile_positions.title: Chair, Certification Board, HU Teacher Training Center, Faculty of Education

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: Interim manager of a team of Secretaries to the Boards of Examiners.
profile_positions.title: Interim Manager, Staff Education and Research

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: Consultant in area of educational law and regulations, Secretary to the Boards of Examiners, and Head Offices of the Boards & Student Affairs. In 2010-2011 reorganized our Boards of Examiners from 13 departmental ones to 3 at the level of its institutes and 1 for all its Master programs. As of 2011-2012 Secretary to the Boards of Examiners and Manager Offices of Student Affairs/Boards of Examiners as well as legal consultant. Chair of the faculty's platform of Chairs of our Boards of Examiners.
profile_positions.title: Consultant and Coordinating secretary to the Boards of Examiners, Faculty of Health Care

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: Helped in formulating the university’s internationalization policy, for both international exchange of students & staff and Internationalization at Home (in teaching and research activities). Advising the Executive Board and faculty deans (“faculteitsdirecteuren”) in this area as well as chairing both the university-wide committee on internationalization and the Taskforce Internationalization.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor, Staff Education and Research

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: Interim manager of organizational unit, with approximately 15 members of personnel, dedicated to facilitating international exchange of students and (teaching) staff members.
profile_positions.title: Interim Manager International Office

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: Comparative research on the organizational culture at universities in the U.S. and the Netherlands, with a focus on elements that either promote or inhibit the inclusion and advancement of women and minorities.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: At the central administration, in the area of research (graduate studies, "lectoren", and pre-Master programs).
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor, Staff Education & Research

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: At the central administration for university-wide introduction of the Bachelor-Master structure with focus on introducing the elective minors (in conjunction with student information system Osiris).
profile_positions.title: Project Manager, Staff Education & Research

profile_positions.company: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
profile_positions.description: At the central administration, managing the revision of university-wide Education and Examination Regulations (OER) and chairing the university-wide committee charged with working out some important details and finding consensus on them among the six faculties.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager, Staff Education & Research

profile_positions.company: Author
profile_positions.description:
Publications±
• “Nörwegian ïsnötte their language or is it?”, http://www.eaie.org/trondheim/writing, November 2007 (short piece about annual EAIE conference in 2007, held in Trondheim, Norway). Written for creative writing contest organized by the European Association for International Education [EAIE] and The International Herald Tribune.

• “Everybody Happy in Graduate School: Empowering Graduate Students, Supporting Their Advisors, and Increasing the Graduation Rate for Ph.D.’s in the Humanities at Utrecht University”,  ADE Bulletin [journal of the American Departments of English, published by the Modern Language Association in New York], 141-142, Winter/Spring 2007, pp. 24-31. 

• with Rosi Braidotti, “The Women’s Studies Ph.D. in Europe: An Archive”, NWSA Journal [publication of the American National Women’s Studies Association, Indiana University Press], 17:3, Fall 2005, pp. 157-172.
	
• “Gevoelstemperatuur,” a column in Pandora [Utrecht University], 17:2, June 2002, p. 9.
	
• with Christien Franken, “Zonder protest holt de emancipatie achteruit”, Trouw, April 2, 2002, p. 15.
profile_positions.title: Author

company.name: VSB Fonds together with Hogeschool Utrecht and Nuffic

profile_positions.company: VSB Fonds together with Hogeschool Utrecht and Nuffic
profile_positions.description: Chair of committee charged with selecting applicants for funding by the VSB Fonds to do a Master program abroad.
profile_positions.title: Chair International Scholarship Selection Committee

company.name: Utrecht University, Faculty of the Humanities

profile_positions.company: Utrecht University, Faculty of the Humanities
profile_positions.description: Member of advisory board for chaired professor of Gender and Ethnicity, Prof. Gloria Wekker.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Board Professorial Chair Gender & Ethnicity

profile_positions.company: Utrecht University
profile_positions.description: At the central administration, redesigning the university teaching certificates (Basis- en Senior-kwalificaties onderwijs).
profile_positions.title: Policy Advisor, University Strategic Program

profile_positions.company: Utrecht University
profile_positions.title: Researcher, Research Institute for History and Culture

profile_positions.company: Utrecht University
profile_positions.description: Redesigning and building up the graduate studies program, so that there was more direct supervision of graduate students and their progress in order to improve retention and graduation rates. In time a similar system was put into place for postdocs.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Studies and Postdoc Coordinator, Research Institute for History and Culture.

profile_positions.company: Utrecht University
profile_positions.description: Taught courses on speaking, grammar, writing, American Literature and Culture (1607-1900), Women's Writing, The Jewish-American Novel, and American Modernism. Also supervised internships and theses.
profile_positions.title: Tenured professor of English and American Studies, Department of English

profile_positions.company: Author
profile_positions.description:
Publications:
• Translator of Cheri Huber’s The Key, published as Zijn wie je bent, by Servire Uitgevers (Utrecht),  2000.
	
• “Call Me:  The Story of Moby-Dick,” in Writing on the Edge [University of California at Davis], guest editor Peter Elbow, 10:2/11:1, Spring/Summer 1999 - Fall/Winter 2000, pp. 142-146.

• with Frans Ruiter, “Letteren-promovendi op de arbeidsmarkt”, written for national distribution by the Research Institute for History and Culture (Utrecht University), summer 1999.
	
• "One Author in Search of a Character:  Ezra Pound's 'Homage to Sextus Propertius,'" in Ton Hoenselaars and Paul Franssen, eds., The Author as Character:  Representing Historical Writers in Western Literature (Madison, NJ: Fairleigh Dickinson University Press, 1999), pp. 181-194.
	
• with Frans Ruiter, "Notitie over het onderwijs van de landelijke onderzoekscholen", written for national distribution by the Research Institute for History and Culture, October 1997.
profile_positions.title: Author

profile_positions.company: Author
profile_positions.description:
Publications: 	
• "The 'Serious' Poet and the Phallus:  The Gender Politics of Ezra Pound," in Frame:  Tijdschrift voor Literatuurwetenschap [Utrecht University], 10:2,1995, pp. 19-25.
	
• with Mary Armstrong and Angelika von Wahl, "Building the Feminist Academy:  Changing the Disciplines in 1994," in Frame: Tijdschrift voor Literatuurwetenschap, 9:2/3, 1994, pp. 96-101.
	
• “The Berlin Watershed Conference,” in Essenses:  Journal of the Netherlands Society for English Studies, 4:1/2, december 1994, pp. 28-29.
	
• "The Left in American Literature:  Dos Passos, Bonner, LeSueur, and Smedley," written for national distribution by U.S. Information Service, The Hague, The Netherlands, 1994.
	
• "Feminism Was a Dirty Word" and "Easier Said Than Done," in Jean O'Barr and Mary Wyer, eds., Engaging Feminism  (Charlottesville, VA: University Press of Virginia, 1992), pp. 116-117 and pp. 119-120.
	
• August Strindberg and Samuel Beckett:  a Comparative Study, internal publication, National Endowment for the Humanities, Washington, D.C., 1985.
profile_positions.title: Author

profile_positions.company: Duke University
profile_positions.description: Coached new instructors in the University Writing Program.
profile_positions.title: Veteran Assistant in Teaching, University Writing Program

profile_positions.company: Duke University
profile_positions.description: Consulting with and coaching (adult) students writing their Master theses.
profile_positions.title: Writing Consultant, Master of Arts in Liberal Studies (MALS) Program

profile_positions.company: Duke University
profile_positions.description: Taught undergraduate courses on writing, the American short story, and Modernism ("Paris in the 1920s").
profile_positions.title: Graduate Instructor, English Department and University Writing Program

profile_positions.company: The Samuel Beckett Correspondence Project
profile_positions.description: Translation (French-English) and annotation of correspondence by and to Samuel Beckett as well as conducting related research. Under the supervision of Martha Fehsenfeld, Chapel Hill, NC.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Researcher and Translator
